sourcesContent:
import React, {Component} from 'react' import { Link } from 'react-router-dom' const inputTag = { width: '100%', padding: '10px 20px', borderRadius: '5px', border: '1px solid grey'} const reduceSize = { width: '30%', padding: '10px 20px', borderRadius: '5px', border: '1px solid grey' } const pDisplay = { paddingLeft: '10px', paddingRight: '10px', fontSize: '20px', display: 'inline'} class Purchase extends Component { constructor() { super() this.state = { firstName: '', lastName: '', address: '', city_town: '', staProReg: '', zip: '', country: '', cardNum: '', cardType: '', cvv: 0, month: 0, year: 0 } this.handleChange = this.handleChange.bind(this) this.handleSubmit = this.handleSubmit.bind(this) } handleChange(event) { const {name, value} = event.target this.setState({[name] : value}) } handleSubmit(event) { //check in every field is filled out this.state.map(check => { if(check) { //for card number and cvv let isNum = /^\d+$/.test(this.state.cardNum) let isCVV = /^\d+$/.test(this.state.cvv) if (isNum === true && isCVV === true) { //only numbers used alert('Submitted') } else { alert('invalid card number') } }else { alert('Missing information') } return check }) //remember to change the submit alert to a link event.preventDefault() } // render() { return ( <>

) } } //make sure that the radio button replaces the input of the 'Name On Package' when checked and clears when unchecked //make 'onsubmit' functions //store info when submitted in database //record all inputted data and store them accordingly within each database section //call the databases required to do so //use state variables to store data export default Purchase
